text: The 2019 European Table Tennis Championships were held in Nantes, France from 3–8 September 2019. The venue for the competition was Salle Sportive Métropolitaine. The competition featured team events for men and women, with the winning teams qualifying for the 2019 ITTF Team World Cup. ==Schedule== Two team events were contested. {| class="wikitable" |- | || Group phase |- | style="background: #FADFAD"| ||Rounds in Main Draw |- | style="background: #FFD700"| ||Finals |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- valign="bottom" !Date || 3 September || 4 September || 5 September || 6 September || 7 September || 8 September |- |Men's team | GS || GS || GS ||style="background: #FADFAD"| QF || style="background: #FADFAD"| SF || style="background: #FFD700"|F |- |Women's team | GS || GS || GS ||style="background: #FADFAD"| QF || style="background: #FADFAD"| SF || style="background: #FFD700"|F |} ==Medalists== {| |- |rowspan=2|Men's team |rowspan=2| Timo Boll Dimitrij Ovtcharov Patrick Franziska Benedikt Duda Ruwen Filus |rowspan=2| Tiago Apolónia Marcos Freitas João Monteiro Diogo Carvalho Diogo Chen | Simon Gauzy Emmanuel Lebesson Can Akkuzu Tristan Flore Andrea Landrieu |- | Mattias Falck Kristian Karlsson Jon Persson Truls Möregårdh Anton Källberg |- |rowspan=2|Women's team |rowspan=2| Bernadette Szőcs Elizabeta Samara Daniela Dodean Irina Ciobanu Adina Diaconu |rowspan=2| Fu Yu Shao Jieni Leila Oliveira Rita Fins | Li Qian Natalia Partyka Natalia Bajor Julia Slazak Anna Wegrzyn |- | Georgina Póta Dóra Madarász Szandra Pergel Leonie Hartbrich |} ==See also== *2019 Europe Top 16 Cup *2019 ITTF World Tour *2019 ITTF World Tour Grand Finals ==References== ==External links== *Official website *ITTF website *ETTU website Category:European Table Tennis Championships European Table Tennis Championships European Table Tennis Championships Category:International sports competitions hosted by France Category:Table tennis competitions in France European Table Tennis Category:Sport in Nantes
